meaningMnemonic: If your <radical>fingers</radical> are strong enough, you can take an <radical>axe</radical> and <kanji>fold</kanji> it in half. But be careful not to <kanji>bend</kanji> it too far, or you might just <kanji>break</kanji> it!
readingMnemonic: Unfortunately, as you <kanji>fold</kanji> these axes in half you realize they come in <reading>sets</reading> (せつ), so there are twice the axes you thought there would be. To compensate, you start folding them in sets too.
